back: RV with a finite number of values, all of which have the same probability
RV with two values. Usually 0 and 1, with $p$ such that $P(B=1) = p$ and $P(B=0) = 1-p$.
RV representing number of successes on $N$ independent Bernoulli($p$) trials. $P(N=k) = \binom{N}{k} p^k (1-p)^{N-k}$, $k=0,1,\dots,N$
For repeated, independent Binomial($p$) trials, RV $G$ is number of trials to first success.  $p_G(k) = p(1-p)^{k-1}$, $k=1,2,\ldots$
Models events that occur randomly over time (or space). If average of $\alpha$ events in observation window, \[p_X(k) = \frac{\alpha^k}{k!} e^{- \alpha},~~k = 0, 1, \ldots\]
